headline: 15 New Books Coming in October
snippet: A deeply reported history of Covid-19; Maggie Haberman’s look at Donald J. Trump; stories by George Saunders, Alan Moore and Samanta Schweblin; and more.
abstract: A deeply reported history of Covid-19; Maggie Haberman’s look at Donald J. Trump; stories by George Saunders, Alan Moore and Samanta Schweblin; and more.

headline: I Escaped Poverty, but Hunger Still Haunts Me
snippet: Food was scarce when I was growing up, so I ate all I could when I had the chance.
abstract: Food was scarce when I was growing up, so I ate all I could when I had the chance.

headline: The Guardrails
snippet: A new class of American evangelical leaders is shaking up the Republican Party — and raising the stakes of the midterm elections.
abstract: A new class of American evangelical leaders is shaking up the Republican Party — and raising the stakes of the midterm elections.

headline: An Obama Book That Cuts Obama Out of the Picture
Primary Care Doctors, Overwhelmed
snippet: Readers respond to a story about a rural doctor with a heart condition brought on by her work. Also: Italy’s election; the MAGA threat; whales; carriage horses.
abstract: Readers respond to a story about a rural doctor with a heart condition brought on by her work. Also: Italy’s election; the MAGA threat; whales; carriage horses.

headline: They Pay $500 a Month for a Loft in Brooklyn
snippet: A lucky couple lives on the top floor of a building that was once a potato chip factory.
abstract: A lucky couple lives on the top floor of a building that was once a potato chip factory.

headline: Youngkin Stumps With Kemp in Georgia, Urging Conservatives to Vote
snippet: Brian Kemp’s re-election campaign has drawn a string of Republicans who have kept Donald Trump at a relative arm’s length.
abstract: Brian Kemp’s re-election campaign has drawn a string of Republicans who have kept Donald Trump at a relative arm’s length.

headline: Liberal Politics Needs a Lifeline. Emotion Could Be it.
snippet: A Polish historian and journalist says she believes it is time for liberal politicians to lean harder on emotion the way populists have for years.
abstract: A Polish historian and journalist says she believes it is time for liberal politicians to lean harder on emotion the way populists have for years.

headline: Ban Ki-moon Is Not Leading the U.N. Anymore, but He’s Still Working to Make Change
snippet: The former secretary general of the United Nations is striving to knock down barriers, foster friendship among nations, and campaign for peace and conflict resolution.
abstract: The former secretary general of the United Nations is striving to knock down barriers, foster friendship among nations, and campaign for peace and conflict resolution.

headline: European Political Turmoil Roils Global Markets
snippet: Stocks and bonds in Europe and Asia fell on Monday, as did futures in American markets, as developments in Britain and Italy weighed on investors.
abstract: Stocks and bonds in Europe and Asia fell on Monday, as did futures in American markets, as developments in Britain and Italy weighed on investors.
byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Bernhard Warner, Vivian Giang, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
